TopicTitle: Stop RCS Auto Adjusting While On EVA?

Articles.Content:
Kerbals "auto adjust" RCS on their own while on EVA. For example, when I hit Q or E to "spin" there is some sort of automatic adjusting that the RCS thrusters do. It is VERY annoying to me and I'd LOVE to disable it somehow. Any suggestions?

To recreate this, simply perform EVA, engage RCS, hit the Q or E key and observe the game auto adjusting your kerbal.
The SAS toggle sets this. All you have to do is turn off SAS for your Kerbonauts when they are on EVA, and they won't do that anymore.

1 hour ago, bewing said:

I don't have SAS on and it still does this

3 hours ago, Gianni1122 said:

I don't have SAS on and it still does this

There is also a button in your Main Menu settings that says "Auto Adjust to Camera on EVA". Unclick that button, too.

2 minutes ago, bewing said:

There is also a button in your Main Menu settings that says "Auto Adjust to Camera on EVA". Unclick that button, too.

 

Just to be clear I do not use SAS and I'm aware of auto camera adjust setting and key. I should have mentioned that in the OP.

Neither of these things are or fix the issue. Thanks for the replies though
The only other thing that happens is that the damping function for RCS for Kerbals on EVA is very slow -- so RCS swings them back and forth and back and forth. Is that what you mean?

I think the reason this happens is because, as far as I know, Kerbals don't have built-in reaction wheel to rotate them. If a kerbal starts tumbling, nothing can prevent that other than RCS. I would think most players don't want to deal with an uncontrollable Kerbal tumbling in zero-gravity just because the player would like to conserve some EVA propellant. I'd personally would want my Kerbals in full, stable control. The idea of a kerbal in a perpetual drift-spin or manually having to counter rotations sounds like a nightmare.
I may be misinterpreting your question, but have you tried cycling through the camera views (V) until you're in free mode?

@bewing That could be it but I'm not sure. @StahnAileron seems to know what I'm talking about and yes, having to do counter rotations on EVA could be a nightmare but you do it when docking and you do it for the majority of EVA RCS controls (W,A,S,D inputs all require a counter input to "stop")

The point is I know I could manage controlled EVA maneuvering if the game didn't help me counter. I just don't like the idea of the game forcing me to hold hands with it and I really think they should add the option to disable it for people like me who enjoy the challenge

OK, I think I'm beginning to get what you mean. You want 6 DOF control of Kerbals on EVA, with no stability assistance at all? Without a joystick, I don't think it would be workable. On/Off thrust control of the RCS jetpacks with the keyboard would just be a mess -- because the RCS jets pack too much punch for that.
